snippet: The earned income tax credit returns billions of dollars to low-income working Americans with a one-time refund that can amount to 40 percent of annual income for some families.
abstract: Earned income tax credit, a tax refund program that returns billions of dollars to low-income Americans, is increasingly playing a critical role in offering relief to the country's most vulnerable workers.
lead_paragraph: The earned income tax credit returns billions of dollars to low-income working Americans with a one-time refund that can amount to 40 percent of annual income for some families.

headline.seo: Antipoverty Tax Program Offers Relief, Though Temporary
headline.main: Antipoverty Tax Program Offers Relief, Though Often Temporary
headline.print_headline: Antipoverty Tax Program Offers Relief, Though Often Temporary
